intro: Chamaeranthemum reticulatum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and yellow, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. The plant is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
